description: As our Thanksgiving gift to you, we bring you a special photo essay from the Atlanta Journal's Rita Santry McGill as she details the sweet, charmed life of one Oscar the Turkey.
title: Flashback Photos: Oscar the Turkey survives Thanksgiving
title_page: Flashback Photos: Oscar the Turkey survives Thanksgiving
text:
1 / 6
Rita Santry McGill / Atlanta Journal As our Thanksgiving gift to you, we bring you a special photo essay from the Atlanta Journal's Rita Santry McGill as she details the sweet, charmed life of one Oscar the Turkey, who lived in Smyrna, Ga., in 1946 and was a family pet â€“ not the family dinner. Here's how Oscar's story begins: Feb. 13, 1946 - Smyrna, Ga. -- It's a rare bird who uses his neck. But Oscar has made himself such a lovable pet that he'll never be eaten. In grocery stores, Oscar is very careful to stand on the customers' side of the counter.
